title: SJB to support restructuring CPC, SriLankan Airlines
body_lines: Whilst stressing the need for restructuring key government institutions such as Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) and national carrier SriLankan Airlines, the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) today said it will support such restructuring processes.

SJB Puttalam District MP Niroshan Perera told a press conference that key government institutions should be restructured as they are a burden to the people who are already battered. “We stress that the government should go for a restructuring process as soon as possible to ease the burden on the people,” the MP said. Asked whether SJB would support a restructuring process, the MP said his party will support such a programme.

The MP added that Sri Lanka is about to face a diplomatic crisis with the refusal by China for a currency SWAP, while ties with Russia had become doubtful following the Aeroflot drama. “The comments made by the CEB Chief could upset India as well,” he said.
Also he said it is evident that Sri Lanka’s situation had got worse with the appeal made by the UN to the world on June 9 that Sri Lanka needs emergency humanitarian assistance.

He said it was revealed at the meeting of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) that Sri Lanka still needs to import 35,000 MT of red dhal, 540,000 MT of sugar, 1.1 million MT of wheat flour, 120,000 metric tons of potatoes and 36 000 MT of canned fish annually. “The issue is to find dollars to pay for these imports. (Yohan Perera)
